subdivision_of_building:
Rear roof in part only 
side door at ground floor
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings / document title number(s): 857 EX 0S01 (SITE LOCATION PLAN); NH_TCL_000 (EXISTING GROUND FLOOR PLAN); NH_TCL_001 (EXISTING FIRST FLOOR PLAN); 23.10.2748 (EXISTING FRONT ELEVATION); 23.10.2748 (EXISTING SIDE ELEVATION); 23.10.2748 (EXISTING REAR ELEVATION); 259-01 (PROPOSED FIRST FLOOR PLAN); 259-02 (PROPOSED ROOF PLAN); 259-03 (PROPOSED NORTH ELEVATION); 259-04 (PROPOSED EAST ELEVATION); 259-05 (PROPOSED WEST ELEVATION); DESIGN AND ACCESS STATEMENT REVISED MARCH 2024; PLANT NOISE ASSESSMENT (13119.RP01.PNA.1 REV 1 DATED 07/02/2024); NOISE CALCULATION SHEET.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The individual and combined external rating sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment (proposed three condenser units) shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by at least 10dBA at the most noise sensitive receiver locations at the development site and at surrounding premises, in accordance with BS4142:2014 +A1 2019, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity, and in accordance with the plant noise limits in Table 2 of the report by RBA ref. 13119.RP01.PNA.1 dated 7 February 2024.
Machinery, plant and equipment including ducting shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators, and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced.

Mitigation measures shall include impervious enclosures with a minimum mass of 15kg/m2 around all plant and height of at least 500mm above the top of plant items, with substantial waterproof acoustic absorption material covering all internal sides. All mitigation shall be maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration or noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies D6, D13 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
description: External alterations to the building including the installation of AC equipment, the creation of a storage room and the creation of a new entrance door
